column3: Past national BCG vaccination policy for all
At birth (up to 1 year of age) - Before 6 weeks of age

column1: Year of changes to BCG schedule

column3: 1986-93: Stopped universal BCG vaccination in 3 regions; 1994: Russian vaccine replaced by Behring Danish strain; 2001: Stopped vaccination of special groups (i.e. healthcare workers at risk); 2009: Stopped revaccinations; 2010: Changed from universal vaccination to selective vaccination upon request (voluntary); 2015: Danish SSI BCG replaced by Polish BCG, Biomed Lublin

column1: Are there special groups that receive BCG?

column3: Infants at increased risk of TB

column1: Why was the policy discontinued? (if applicable)
column3: 1. High reactogenity and low efficacy/effectiveness of the vaccine 2. Low TB incidence

column1: What was the process of discontinuation? (if applicable)
column3: Lengthy process with discussions and debates between advocates and opponents of stopping universal vaccination

column1: Location of Administration of BCG Vaccine
How long has this BCG vaccine strain been used?
Were there shortages/stockouts of the vaccine?

column3: Due to the shortages and stock-outs of BCG SSI, CR had to switch to Polish BCG.

column1: Is the BCG vaccination policy regularly assessed?
How often is the policy assessed?
column3: Every year (along with assessment of vaccine coverage)
